pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were storing many bowls.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.3: When people who were walking about dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.4: “How can the Sakyan ascetics store many bowls?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.5: Will they start up as bowl merchants or set up a bowl shop?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.6: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.7: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.8: “How can the monks from the group of six have extra bowls?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.9: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha assembled and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.13: “… Foolish men, how can you have extra bowls?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.16: ‘If a monk has an extra bowl, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.17: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.1: Soon afterwards a bowl was given to Venerable Ānanda,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.2: but he wished to give it to Venerable Sāriputta
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.4: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against keeping an extra bowl,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.10: Venerable Ānanda thought, “What should I do in this situation?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.11: He told the Buddha, who said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.12: “How long is it, Ānanda, before Sāriputta returns?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.14: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.15: “Monks, you should keep an extra bowl for ten days at the most.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.16: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.17: ‘A monk should keep an extra bowl for ten days at the most. If he keeps it beyond that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.1: For ten days at the most:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.2: it should be kept for ten days at a maximum.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.4: a bowl that is not determined, nor transferred.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.6: there are two kinds of bowl: the iron bowl and the clay bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.7: And there are three kinds of bowl: the large bowl, the medium bowl, and the small bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.8: The large bowl: it takes half an _āḷhaka_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.9: The medium bowl: it takes a _nāḷika_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.10: The small bowl: it takes a _pattha_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.11: Anything larger than this is not a bowl, nor anything smaller.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.12: If he keeps it beyond that […] entailing relinquishment:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.13: it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the eleventh day.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.14: The bowl should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.15: “And, monks, it should be relinquished in this way.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.16: After approaching the Sangha, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, put the palms of his hands together, and say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.17: ‘Venerables, this bowl that I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.18: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.19: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.20: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.21: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.22: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.23: This bowl that was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so has been relinquished to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.24: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give this bowl back to monk so-and-so.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.25: After approaching several monks, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, put the palms of his hands together, and say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.26: ‘Venerables, this bowl that I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.27: I relinquish it to the venerables.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.28: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.29: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.30: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.32: This bowl that was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so has been relinquished to you.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.33: If it seems appropriate to you, you should give this bowl back to monk so-and-so.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.34: After approaching a single monk, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, put the palms of his hands together, and say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.35: ‘This bowl that I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.37: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.38: The confession should be received by that monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.39: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.40: ‘I give this bowl back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.41: If it is more than ten days and he perceives it as more than ten days, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.42: If it is more than ten days, but he is unsure if it is, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.43: If it is more than ten days, but he perceives it as less than ten days, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.44: If it has not been determined, but he perceives it as determined, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.45: If it has not been transferred, but he perceives it as transferred, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.46: If it has not been given away, but he perceives it as given away, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.47: If it has not been lost, but he perceives it as lost, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.48: If it has not been destroyed, but he perceives it as destroyed, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.49: If it has not been broken, but he perceives it as broken, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.50: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives it as stolen, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.51: If he uses a bowl that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.52: If it is less than ten days, but he perceives it as more than ten days, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.53: If it is less than ten days, but he is unsure if it is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.54: If it is less than ten days and he perceives it as less than ten days, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.56: if within ten days it has been determined, transferred, given away, lost, destroyed, broken, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.58: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.1: At one time monks from the group six did not give back a relinquished bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.3: “Monks, a relinquished bowl should be given back. If you don’t give it back, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.4: The first rule, the training rule on bowls, is finished.
